neighborhoods.name: Blloku
neighborhoods.character: Trendy, vibrant district known for its nightlife, cafes, and modern atmosphere
neighborhoods.location: Central Tirana, west of Skanderbeg Square
neighborhoods.history: Formerly a restricted area for Communist Party officials, now transformed into the city's most fashionable district

practical_info.getting_there: Walking distance from center, accessible by bus

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Popular with young professionals, tourists, and locals seeking entertainment
neighborhoods.tips: Visit in the evening when the area comes alive. Many places don't open until late afternoon. Dress stylishly to fit in with the local crowd.

neighborhoods.name: Skanderbeg Square Area
neighborhoods.character: Historic heart of the city with government buildings, museums, and cultural landmarks
neighborhoods.location: Central Tirana, the main square and surrounding area
neighborhoods.history: Named after Albanian national hero Skanderbeg, this area has been the center of political and cultural life for centuries

practical_info.getting_there: Central location, accessible by all public transport

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Essential for understanding Tirana's history and culture
neighborhoods.tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds and get the best photos. Respect dress codes when visiting religious sites. The area is pedestrian-friendly and perfect for walking tours.

neighborhoods.name: New Bazaar (Pazari i Ri)
neighborhoods.character: Authentic local market area with traditional Albanian atmosphere and fresh produce
neighborhoods.history: Traditional market area that has been modernized while maintaining its authentic character and local flavor

practical_info.getting_there: Walking distance from center, accessible by bus
practical_info.safety: Safe during market hours, be aware of pickpockets in crowds

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium-High - Great for experiencing local culture and finding fresh food
neighborhoods.tips: Visit early morning for the freshest produce and most authentic experience. Bring cash for purchases. Be respectful when taking photos of vendors and their goods.

neighborhoods.name: Blloku Extension (Blloku i Ri)
neighborhoods.character: Modern residential and commercial area with upscale developments and international businesses
neighborhoods.location: West of traditional Blloku, extending toward the airport
neighborhoods.history: Newer development area that has grown rapidly with Tirana's economic development

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Daytime for business, evening for dining

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium - Good for business travelers and those seeking modern amenities
neighborhoods.tips: This area is more business-oriented and less touristy. Good for those seeking a quieter, more modern experience away from the tourist crowds.

neighborhoods.name: Kombinat
neighborhoods.character: Traditional residential area with authentic local life and some industrial heritage
neighborhoods.location: South of the city center, near the Lana River
neighborhoods.history: Originally an industrial area, now primarily residential with some remaining industrial buildings

practical_info.getting_there: Bus connections, walking distance from some areas

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium - Good for experiencing authentic local life
neighborhoods.tips: This is a working-class residential area, so be respectful of local life. Good for photographers seeking authentic scenes. Less tourist infrastructure than other areas.

neighborhoods.name: Tirana e Re (New Tirana)
neighborhoods.character: Modern planned development with contemporary architecture and international standards
neighborhoods.history: Newest major development area, designed with modern urban planning principles
neighborhoods.appeal: Medium - Interesting for architecture enthusiasts and modern urban planning
neighborhoods.tips: This area showcases Tirana's future development. Good for those interested in modern urban planning and contemporary Albanian society. Less historical interest than other areas.
